backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining the backend canister with CRUD operations for Announcements and ContactInquiries, including input validation and timestamped storage using mutable lists.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented features (theme, hero, about, services, announcements, etc.) to their corresponding source files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-sentence summaries of each frontend source file, serving as a reference index for the project's frontend components and hooks.
frontend/index.css: Base Tailwind CSS entry file defining OKLCH CSS custom properties for light and dark themes including background, foreground, primary, and chart color tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the React app, setting the page title to 'Masjid-e-Gausia Welfare Committee' and mounting the app at the root div.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that assembles the single-page layout by composing Header, HeroSection, AboutSection, ServicesSection, AnnouncementsSection, DonateSection, and ContactSection.
frontend/src/components/AboutSection.tsx: About Us section component displaying mission text, a Quranic quote, a statistics panel, and a four-value grid (Compassion, Brotherhood, Education, Integrity) with Lucide icons.
frontend/src/components/AnnouncementsSec: Announcements section that fetches backend announcements via React Query and renders them as dated cards, with loading, error, and empty-state handling.
frontend/src/components/ContactSection.t: Contact section with organization info display and a validated contact form that submits inquiries to the backend canister, showing success or error states after submission.
frontend/src/components/DonateSection.ts: Renders a donation section with impact amounts, bank transfer details, and a contact scroll button, styled with an Islamic geometric background pattern.
frontend/src/components/GeometricDivider: A simple presentational component that renders a decorative geometric divider image as a full-width separator.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Sticky navigation header with logo, desktop nav links, and a collapsible mobile menu, all using smooth-scroll to page sections.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Full-screen hero section with a mosque background image, organization title, tagline, and CTA buttons that smooth-scroll to About and Donate sections.
Displays a grid of six welfare service cards (education, food, medical, etc.) with icons and descriptions, using alternating forest/gold color themes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (anonymous or authenticated) via React Query, invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context and hook, managing AuthClient creation, login/logout flow, and identity persistence across page reloads.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching announcements (sorted by date) and submitting contact inquiries via the ICP backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file that imports Google Fonts (Playfair Display, Cormorant Garamond, Inter), sets up Tailwind base/components/utilities, and defines an Islamic-themed design system with deep green, gold, and cream CSS custom properties for both light and dark modes, plus reusable component classes like `.islamic-pattern-bg` and `.gold-divider`.
frontend/src/main.tsx: React app entry point that mounts the root component wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` (React Query) and `InternetIdentityProvider` for ICP authentication.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the theme with Islamic-palette custom colors (forest, gold, cream), OKLCH-based semantic color tokens, custom font families, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project state manifest (schema v1.0.0, version 3) describing the Masjid-e-Gausia Welfare Committee website, listing implemented features (theme, hero, about, services, announcements, etc.), required images, and architectural metadata.
